Nerangs.ab: u-š pad nǝmō uruuaire wēšag pad ēwkardagīh nigērišn ēn kū wēšag ō wēšag čand pādixšāy ast kē gōwēd ēw +daxšmēst, ast kē ēdōn gōwēd ay bē ka az harw bun-ē tāg-+ē wēned ā nē šāyēd, ast kē ēdōn gōwēd ay ka wāng āšnawēd ā šāyēd

"At nəmō uruuaire, he has to look to the thicket "as a whole". That means that "how much distance is allowed between each thicket. There is one who says: "A daxšmēst". There is one who says: "Except when he sees (at least) a branch from each trunk, it is not permissible." There is one who says: "When he can hear the voice (from one thicket to another), then it is permissible."
nəmō uruuaire vaŋhi mazdaδāte aṣ̌aōni urvar va dār va deraḫt tamām be-negarand
"nəmō uruuaire vaŋhi mazdaδāte aṣ̌aōni. They examine thoroughly the plant, the wood and the three."

Quotations.ab: u-š nəmō uruuaire ān gyāg gōwišn kū barsom cīnēd
"He has to recite nəmō uruuaire at the moment when he cuts the barsom."
ēn kū az wēšag tā ō wēšag cand *pādixšāy ast kē gōwēd ay *daxšmēst gōwēd ast kē ēdōn gōwēd ay be ka az harw *bun-ē tāg-ē wēnēd tā nē šāyēd ast kē ēdōn gōwēd ay ka wāng ašnawēd ā šāyēd

"As to the (question) of how much distance it is permissible from thicket to thicket, there is one who says: "A daxšmēst." There is one who says thus: "Unless he sees a twig from each tree, it is not proper."There is one who says thus: "If he can hear a call, then it is permissible."
